thread.title: Sarah Paulson collects all five major TV awards in 1 year | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Sarah Paulson collects all five major TV awards in 1 year | Daily Mail Online

author: Kirkristen For Dailymail.Com
title: Sarah Paulson collects all five major TV awards in 1 year | Daily Mail Online
text: Published: 03:40 GMT, 1 February 2017 | Updated: 03:40 GMT, 1 February 2017 11 shares comments Sarah Paulson made television history this award season. The 42-year-old actress swept up all five major TV awards for her portrayal of Marcia Clark on FX’s The People v O.J. Simpson: American Crime Story. She is the only actress to ever win an Emmy, Golden Globe, SAG, Critics’ Choice, and Television Critics Association award all in the same award circuit. Congrats! Sarah Paulson swept up all five major TV awards this award circuit. On Sunday, her SAG win secured her with the record breaking fete Role of a lifetime: The 42-year-old actress swept award season for her portrayal of Marcia Clark on FX’s The People v O.J. Simpson: American Crime Story Sarah's winning streak began in August when she accepted the award for 'Individual Achievement In Drama' at the 32nd annual Television Critics Association Awards. In September, the actress proudly showed off her gold statue at the 68th annual Primetime Emmy Awards. No. 1: Sarah's winning streak began in August when she accepted the award for 'Individual Achievement In Drama' at the 32nd annual Television Critics Association Awards No. 2: In September, the actress proudly showed off her gold statue at the 68th annual Primetime Emmy Awards Then in December Sarah took home another trophy for her role at the 22nd annual Critics' Choice Awards held in Santa Monica, California. Sarah went on to win again at the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards which took place on January 8 in Los Angeles. And this past weekend, the talented beauty's win at the 23rd Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards secured her recording breaking fete. No. 3: Then in December Sarah took home another trophy for her role at the 22nd annual Critics' Choice Awards held in Santa Monica, California No. 4: Sarah went on to win again at the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards which took place on January 8 in Los Angeles
